page.title: 06SOCIAL LIFE IN KEMBERTON
page.content: The village hall is a former school which was originally provided by the Kenyon-Slaney family. The village hall committee purchased it in 1983 for Â£5000 with the help of a grant from Bridgnorth Council. It is used for meetings of the Parish Council, keep fit class, dog club and Women's Institute and can be hired for special occasions. The Women's Institute is involved in most of the village's social activities and organises a Christmas party. Other annual events include an autumn fair, a bonfire party, a meeting of the Albrighton Hunt and a Boxing Day walk. There are also coffee mornings, cheese and wine evenings and car treasure hunts. The money raised is donated to charity. The Masons' Arms public house was re- opened in July 1985 after renovation.
